meanings.definition: The state or quality of being timid.
meanings.sent1: Her timidness was evident in the way she avoided eye contact.
meanings.sent2: His timidness often made him hesitate to speak up in class.
meanings.sent3: Despite her timidness, she managed to muster the courage to ask a question.
meanings.sent4: The timidness of the rabbit in the face of danger was quite noticeable.
meanings.sent5: The timidness of the mouse was so extreme that it rarely ventured out of its hole.

meanings.definition: The act of showing fear or lack of confidence.
meanings.sent1: The timidness in her voice revealed her nervousness.
meanings.sent2: His timidness during the presentation was palpable to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's timidness around strangers was both endearing and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The timidness of the new student was like a neon sign of insecurity.
meanings.sent5: The timidness of the puppy was so adorable that it melted everyone's hearts.
